subject: Re: [junit] Re: Junit executing tests in separate "clean" processes
msgSnippet: Kick off a VM with System.exec(..) and then connect to it via RMI to write the data; verify the data written in your JUnit process. You may actually want two
messageBody:
Kick off a VM with System.exec(..) and then connect to it via RMI to write
the data; verify the data written in your JUnit process. You may actually
want two clean VMs: one to write in and one to read in. Have Ant set a
system property for you with the details of how to find the Java process
and kick off the VM.

I've never done this with JUnit, though I had to do something very similar
quite a while ago with an in-house test framework. The only real problem
was that some classes that were not serializable had to be wrapped or
manually martialed in order to set up the test data or do the comparison.
For instance, you can't (easily) control a Stream via RMI.
